title: Grenoble
summary: Grenoble (/ɡrəˈnoʊbəl/ grə-NOH-bəl,[3] French: [ɡʁənɔbl] (listen); Arpitan: Grenoblo, Grainóvol, Occitan: Graçanòbol, Grasanòbol) is the prefecture and largest city of the Isère department in the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region of southeastern France.[4] It is located within the Dauphiné historical province and lies where the river Drac joins the Isère at the foot of the French Alps.
